BUGEMA UNIVERSITY ACADEMIC BULLETIN 2024-2029 - This is the official academic guide for students admitted between 2024-2029. The bulletin contains academic policies, program requirements, university regulations, and graduation requirements. The last graduation under this bulletin will be November 2028, after which it will be phased out. Students should refer to this bulletin throughout their academic journey at Bugema University.

FIRST SEMESTER: Aug 5 - Dec 13, 2024 (Classes: Aug 19; Registration closes Aug 28; Exams: Nov 25-Dec 13). CHRISTMAS BREAK: Dec 16, 2024 - Jan 5, 2025. SECOND SEMESTER: Jan 13 - May 16, 2025 (Classes: Jan 20; Exams: Apr 28-May 14). SUMMER SCHOOL: May 19 - July 16, 2025. Graduation: Nov 8-10, 2024. Mid-semester breaks: Oct 7-11, 2024; Mar 17-21, 2025.

Bugema University prohibits all forms of academic dishonesty: PLAGIARISM (25% maximum allowed in research); CHEATING (copying, cheat sheets, impersonation); MISREPRESENTATION (fabricating sources); ACADEMIC MISCONDUCT (selling papers, changing grades, theft). Penalties apply as per Examination Policy Handbook. Research papers/thesis must comply with 25% plagiarism policy.
Academic Grievances Resolution: 1. Try resolve with course instructor; 2. Head of Department; 3. Dean of School; 4. Senate if unresolved. All grievances should be resolved at lowest possible level.

Academic Probation Policy: Warning - GPA below 2.00 in one semester; Probation/Suspension - GPA below 2.00 for two consecutive semesters (one academic year suspension); Termination - GPA below 2.00 after probation period.

Adding/Dropping Courses: Fill form from Registrar's Office; Get lecturer approval; Return form to Registrar's Office; Fee charged for changes. Deadlines: Adding - up to published 'Last day to enter any class'; Dropping - by deadline (no record); Dropping after deadline = F grade recorded.

UNDERGRADUATE DEGREE: O-level with 5 passes including English; A-level with 2 principal passes or equivalent; HEAC with GPA 2.8+; Mature Entry Exam pass (age 25+); Relevant diploma. DIPLOMA PROGRAMS: O-level with 4 passes including English; A-level with 1 principal pass; HEAC with GPA 2.5+; Relevant certificate. HIGHER EDUCATION ACCESS CERTIFICATE: UACE with 2 subsidiary passes; Vocational qualifications level 2/3; Foreign qualifications equivalent. CERTIFICATE PROGRAMS: O-level with 4 passes; HEAC with GPA 2.0+. Note: Specific programs may have additional requirements.

1. Obtain application form from Registrar's office, liaison offices, or website (www.bugemouniv.ac.ug). 2. Fill form correctly and attach copies of academic certificates. 3. Pay application fee as stipulated. 4. Return documents to Registrar's office at least 3 weeks before academic year begins. Acceptance: You will receive acceptance letter if application is successful. Only come to university after receiving acceptance letter.

Attendance Policy: Required for all classes (lectures, tutorials, practicals). Excused absences: Illness, authorized trips, circumstances beyond control. Unexcused absences: Other reasons. Makeup work: Allowed for excused absences; Not allowed for unexcused absences. Excessive absences: Exceeding 15% of contact hours may require dropping course. Tardiness: 5-10 minutes late 3 times = 1 absence; 15+ minutes late or missing 15+ minutes = absence.

Auditing Courses: Fill designated form from Registrar's Office; Pay 70% of fee per credit unit; May attend classes regularly; No quizzes or examinations; No credits or grades given; If credit desired later, must repeat course at another time.

The Bachelor of Software Engineering at Bugema University School of Science and Technology prepares students for careers in software development. The program includes courses in: Programming (Java, Python, C++), Web Development, Mobile App Development, Database Systems, Software Design Patterns, Software Testing, Software Project Management, Cybersecurity, Artificial Intelligence, and Cloud Computing. Duration: 4 years (8 semesters). Career opportunities: Software Developer, Web Developer, Mobile App Developer, Software Tester, Systems Analyst, IT Consultant.

Certificate/Transcript Collection: Ready 1 month after graduation; Collect personally within 1 year; After 1 year: $2/month surcharge; Previous uncollected documents also charged; Safe custody at Registrar's Office: $1/month; Reprint/corrections handled by officers. Alternative collection: Legally registered spouse/sponsor/guardian; Or DHL delivery (preferred).

Challenge Examinations: For students with prior knowledge of introductory courses. Restrictions: Not for failed/repeated courses; Maximum 6-8 credits through challenge exams. Procedure: Written request to Head of Department; Department presents to Senate; Approval letter sent; Obtain form from Registrar; Pay 75% of course tuition fee; Take exam.

Bulletin Change Policy: Academic bulletin valid for 5 years; After expiry, additional 5 years given for last cohort to graduate; Current bulletin 2024-2029 graduates last cohort November 2033. If bulletin changes while student enrolled, evaluation by Head of Department determines course adaptations.

Change Campus/Centre: Timing - Beginning of academic year; Procedure - Fill designated form from host campus, get department clearance, receive transfer letter and assessment sheet. Restrictions: Not allowed without proper procedure; Not allowed if remaining with one semester; Only at end/beginning of academic year.

Changing Program/Department: Acceptable with department heads and Registrar guidance. Requirements: Complete 18 credit hours (one semester) first; Check with current and new departments for qualifications; Obtain Change of Major/Program Form from Registrar's Office; Apply for transfer.

The Department of Computing and Informatics at Bugema University School of Science and Technology offers: 1. BSc Software Engineering - Focus on software development and engineering principles; 2. BSc Network Systems Administration - Focus on computer networks and system administration; 3. B Business Computing - Business applications of computing; 4. B Library and Information Science - Information management; 5. B Information Technology - Broad IT skills; 6. Diploma in Computer Forensics; 7. Diploma in Information Technology; 8. Certificate in Information Technology.

Coursework (Continuous Assessment) = 50% of final grade. Components: Assignments, projects, presentations, quizzes, tests, mid-semester exams (combination depends on lecturer). Submission deadline: Within semester unless special arrangements. Late submission: Not accepted after semester ends. Failed coursework: Cannot be supplemented after semester closes.

Dead Semester/Year: Student unable to continue classes for semester/year should submit application to Registrar through department, supported by sponsor communication. Failure to apply may require reapplication upon return.

ERMS (Educational Resource Management System): portal.bugemauniv.ac.ug. Uses: View results, register courses, check fees balance, download transcripts, access course materials. Login: Student number and password. Parents can access with student's ID and password to monitor progress. Assessment sheet: Print once free; additional copies attract fee.

Exam Remarking Procedure: 1. Obtain Head of Department approval; 2. Pay required remarking fee; 3. Submit application to Head of Department. Script retention: Lecturers submit scripts to departments; Keep grade backups; Scripts may be destroyed after 3 years per Senate instruction.

Final Exams = 50% of grade. All students must take final exams. Failure to take exam = F grade. Special exams: Available for illness/emergency with DVC approval, fee payment, within 1 academic year. Exam periods: Last 2 weeks of semester; 2 sessions daily (9am-12pm, 2pm-5pm). Prerequisite: All fees must be paid or arrangements made. Rules: Bring exam pass & student ID; Sign attendance; No admission after 30 minutes; No borrowing; Only non-programmable calculators; No phones/electronic devices.

Refund Policy: Applies to course load changes, withdrawal, dropout, expulsion, non-completion. Effective date: Date student notifies university or last class attended. Institutional Charges Refund: Week 1 - 80%; Week 2 - 70%; Weeks 3-4 - 60%; Week 5 - 50%; After Week 5 - 0%. Summer/Holiday Refund: First 2 class days - 80%; Next 4 days - 10% less each day; After 5 days - 0%.

General Financial Matters: University can withhold registration materials, results, transcripts, diplomas for unpaid amounts. Fees covered: Tuition, room/board, library fines, book costs, damages. Students responsible for breakage/damage costs. Personal effects should be insured; University accepts no liability for loss/damage. Postdated cheques not accepted. Bounced cheques treated per bank/government regulations.

General Education Courses (GEC): Required for all students. Seven areas: Religion, Health, Computer Skills, Writing Skills, Science/Math, Social Awareness, Vocational Studies. Requirement: At least one course in each area. Total credits: 21. Diploma/Certificate students: Required courses: Christian Beliefs, Health Principles, Fundamentals of Computer, Introduction to Writing Skills (13 credits).

GPA Calculation Method: Multiply credits for each course by grade points, sum all, divide by total credits. Example: Course 1: A (5.00) × 3 credits = 15.00; Course 2: B (4.00) × 3 credits = 12.00; etc. Total points ÷ Total credits = GPA. Cumulative GPA determines degree classification.

Grading Scale: 80-100% = A (5.00 GPA) Excellent; 75-79.99% = B+ (4.50) Above Average; 70-74.99% = B (4.00) Average; 65-69.99% = C+ (3.50) Below Average; 50-64.99% = C (3.00) Pass; 0-49.99% = D (2.00) Failure. Degree Classification: First Class = 4.40-5.00 (Summa cum laude); Second Class Upper = 3.60-4.39 (Magna cum laude); Second Class Lower = 2.80-3.59 (Cum laude).

Graduation in Absentia: Candidates must be present unless permission granted. Application: Submit written request to DVC - Academics at least 3 weeks before convocation; Include reason and fee; Permission only for obvious necessity. Procedure: Apply with genuine reasons; Must fulfill all requirements including fee payment. Restriction: Not granted when student is on campus.

Graduation Requirements: 1. Complete all required course credits; 2. Clear all outstanding fees; 3. No disciplinary cases; 4. Apply through academic registry; 5. Minimum GPA requirements: Major - 2.25, Minor - 2.00, Cumulative - 2.00; 6. No grades below D accepted; 7. Complete major, minor, cognate (if required); 8. Complete General Education courses; 9. Submit transfer transcripts if applicable; 10. Clear all service departments.

HEAC (Higher Education Access Certificate): For students whose qualifications not equivalent to UACE. Categories: HEAC Humanities (Business/Arts/Theology); HEAC Physical Sciences (Computing/Technology); HEAC Biological Studies (Nursing/Agriculture/Health). Admission: UACE with 2 subsidiary passes; Vocational qualifications level 2/3; Foreign qualifications with 5 subjects minimum grade C. Program: 2 semesters, 40-44 credits. Required before degree/diploma if qualifications insufficient.

International students may be admitted provisionally with comparable certification from their country. Documents needed: Valid passport, academic transcripts, student visa, medical insurance. Students from non-A-level systems (e.g., Kenya) must enroll for Higher Education Access Certificate (HEAC). International students should contact the international students office for assistance with accommodation and orientation.

Internship/Industrial Training: Required for many programs (e.g., Agriculture - 2 months in second year summer). Purpose: Practical knowledge exposure, research skills enhancement, field expertise development. Industrial Training I & II courses (3 credits each) for some programs.
Late Fees: Continuing students reporting after normal registration charged late fee; Amount increases daily to maximum UGX 300,000; Purpose: Encourage early arrival and registration.

Late registration policy: Students with valid reasons can register late; A fee that increases daily is charged; Late registration officially closes at discretion of DVC Academic Affairs; Special cases (accidents, death in family) considered with consultation to ascertain if coursework was done.

Lost/Damaged Documents Replacement: Bugema University may issue duplicate original certificate with Senate action. Requirements: 1. Hand-written signed request letter; 2. Police report; 3. Affidavit from recognized firm/lawyer; 4. Payment for certificate reprint.

Mature Entry Examination: For individuals who don't meet minimum requirements but have adequate knowledge (formal/informal). Requirements: Must be at least 25 years old; Must take exam from NCHE authorized centers only. This is an aptitude test that allows qualified mature students to gain university admission.

Program Duration: Degree programs - 3-4 years (max 7 years); Diploma/Certificate - 2 years (max 5 years); HEAC - 1 year (2 semesters). Breaking residency: Less than 7 years - retain completed work if bulletin unchanged; 7+ years - forfeit previous work, re-admission required.

Comprehensive Programs Offered: AGRICULTURE: BSc Agriculture (Crop/Animal), BSc Agribusiness, BSc Environmental Science, BSc Food Technology. BUSINESS: BBA, BSc Accounting, BSc Finance, BA HRM, BA Economics, B Entrepreneurship, B Procurement, B Secretarial. EDUCATION: BA/BSc with Education, Diplomas. HEALTH: B Nursing Science. SCIENCE/TECH: BSc Software Engineering, BSc Network Admin, B Business Computing, B Info Tech, BSc Statistics, BSc Biochemistry. SOCIAL SCIENCES: BA Development, BA Community Dev, BA Humanitarian, BA Journalism, B Public Admin, B Social Work, BSc Psychology. THEOLOGY: B Theology, BA Religious Studies. Plus Diplomas & Certificates in all fields.

Registration involves 4 steps: STEP 1 - BUSINESS OFFICE: Arrange financial payment, obtain financial clearance. STEP 2 - ACADEMIC DEPARTMENT: Obtain registration form, pay club fee, select courses with advisor, upload in ERMS, get chairperson approval. STEP 3 - DEAN OF STUDENTS: Obtain residential status, register for BUSA, clear club obligations, submit BUSA receipt, collect Student Handbook. STEP 4 - REGISTRAR'S OFFICE: Complete registration details, obtain Registration Card, collect Academic Bulletin. Late registration available with daily increasing fee.

Research Project Requirement: All degree programs require independent research as capstone. Procedure: Present proposal, conduct research, write thesis/journal manuscript under supervisor guidance, present orally at seminar before panel. Research coordinator assigns mentor/supervisor.

keyword: school of agricultural and applied sciences
answer: School of Agricultural and Applied Sciences: Dean - Assoc. Prof. Paul Nampala, PhD. Philosophy: Science as study of God's handiwork to sustain mankind. Mission: Train holistic professionals in Agricultural Sciences and Rural Development. Vision: Center of excellence in Research, Training, Community Engagement, Sustainable Innovations. Departments: Agricultural & Environmental Sciences; Nutrition, Food Science & Technology. Programs: BSc Agriculture (Crop/Animal Science), BSc Agribusiness Innovation & Management, BSc Environmental Science, BSc Food Technology & Human Nutrition, Diplomas, Certificates.

School of Business: Departments: Accounting & Finance; Management. Programs: BBA, BSc Accounting, BSc Finance & Banking, BA HRM, BA Economics, B Entrepreneurship, B Procurement & Supply Chain, B Secretarial Studies, Diplomas in related fields.

School of Education: Departments: Arts Education; Science Education; Institute of Professional Growth. Programs: BA with Education, BSc with Education, Diploma in Education (Primary/Secondary), various teaching subjects including Economics, Entrepreneurship, Business Studies, Geography, History, Religious Education, Languages, Sciences, Agriculture, ICT.

keyword: school of health and allied sciences
answer: School of Health and Allied Sciences: Department of Nursing and Midwifery. Programs: Bachelor of Nursing Science, Diploma in Nursing, Diploma in Nursing Extension, Certificate in Nursing.

School of Science and Technology: Departments: Computing & Informatics; Life & Physical Sciences. Programs: BSc Software Engineering, BSc Network Systems Administration, B Business Computing, B Library & Information Science, B Information Technology, BSc Statistics, BSc Biochemistry, Diplomas in Computer Forensics, IT, Science Lab Tech, Biomedical Engineering, Certificates.

School of Social Sciences: Departments: Development & Humanitarian Studies; Public Administration & Management; Social Work. Programs: BA Development Studies, BA Community Development, BA Humanitarian Emergency Management, BA Journalism, BA Peace & Conflict Management, B Public Administration, B Social Work, BSc Psychology & Counseling, Diplomas, Certificates.

keyword: school of theology and religious studies
answer: School of Theology and Religious Studies: Departments: Theology; Religious Studies. Programs: B Theology, BA Religious Studies with Chaplaincy/Development/Evangelism/Urban Ministry options, Diploma in Theology, Certificate in Theology.

Bugema University operates a semester system: Each semester = 18 weeks (1 week registration + 15 weeks instruction + 2 weeks exams). Academic year = 2 regular semesters: 1st semester (mid-August to mid-December); 2nd semester (early January to early May). Credit units: 1 credit unit = one 50-minute class per week for 15 weeks, OR 2 hours tutorial, OR 2-3 hours practical per week. Students expected to spend 2 hours preparation per class hour.

The Bachelor of Science in Software Engineering at Bugema University is a comprehensive program that focuses on designing, developing, testing, and maintaining software systems. The program covers software development methodologies, programming languages, database management, web development, mobile app development, software testing, and project management. Graduates become skilled software engineers capable of creating reliable, efficient, and scalable software solutions for various industries.

DG (Deferred Grade): For courses spanning multiple semesters; No GPA effect. I (Incomplete): For illness/emergency; Must clear within 1 year or becomes F. P (Pass): Pass/fail courses; No GPA contribution. CR (Credit Repeat): When repeating course for better grade; Former grade changed to CR; No GPA contribution. EX (Exemptions): For transferable courses; No GPA calculation.

Summer session purpose: Industrial attachment/practicum. Course offerings: Some departments may offer courses during summer with Senate approval. Requirements: Minimum 5 students must enroll; Only full-time lecturers teach; Students must be in final semester with not more than 2 courses (6 credits) remaining. Duration: Usually 6 weeks. Summer/holiday programs follow different refund schedule.

Supplementary/Retake Exams: Allowed for students who failed final exam but scored minimum 25/50 in coursework. Procedure: Obtain request form from Registrar's Office, fill, supply copies to Business Office, department, Examination Office. Fee: Required. Maximum grade: D (plain). Time limit: Failed course must be cleared within 1 academic year or must repeat course.

Transfer Credits Policy: Bugema University accepts credits from recognized universities. Procedure: Request previous institution to send transcripts directly to Bugema Registrar. Requirements: No grade below D+; Overall GPA ≥ 2.50; Minimum 15 upper division courses (45 credits) in major taken at Bugema; Minimum 5 upper division courses (15 credits) in minor taken at Bugema; Transfer credits not accepted until completion of one semester at Bugema.

Tuition Payment: All fees must be paid before registration. Bank Accounts: Equity Bank (UGX: 1017200261563; KES: 1004203110057); Centenary Bank (UGX: 3100018764); UBA (UGX: 1206000016; Forex: 0113009891); Standard Chartered (Forex: 8702010609600). International Transfers: UBA (SWIFT: UNAFUGKA) or Standard Chartered (SWIFT: SCBLUGKA). Present deposit slip to cashier within deposit month.

Withdrawal Procedure: 1. Obtain clearance form from Registrar's Office; 2. Fill form and obtain all required signatures; 3. Submit completed withdrawal form. Documents issued: Withdrawal letter with partial transcript of covered semester(s). Withdrawal only effective upon form submission.

BUGEMA UNIVERSITY ANTHEM:
Onward to progress, Bugema
Ever serving, ever shining
Countless youths have left your portals
Ready to share the wonderful light;
Our prayers will rise for you
Wherever we may go
Our good work will show
That we’re ever true to you.

Onward, Bugema!
O’er the valleys and the hills
Shine on, Bugema!
O’er the plains and cities too;
Lead on, press on, Bugema!
Our praises will ring true.

Keep the standards high, Bugema
Ever waving, ever rising
For on you depends the future
Of many a youth both far and near;
So together we sing
And together we serve
Till the Lord’s coming
Bugema, you shall stand.

UGANDA NATIONAL ANTHEM:
Oh Uganda!
May God uphold Thee,
We lay our future in thy hand,
United, free,
For liberty,
Together we’ll always stand.

Oh Uganda!
The land of Freedom,
Our love and labor we give,
And with neighbours’ all,
At our Country’s call,
In peace and friendship, we’ll live.

Oh Uganda!
The land that Feeds us,
By sun and fertile soil grown,
For our own dear land,
We’ll always stand,
The Pearl of Africa’s Crown.

EAST AFRICAN COMMUNITY ANTHEM:
Chorus:
Jumuiya Yetu sote tuilinde
Tuwajibike tuimarike
Umoja wetu ni nguzo yetu
Idumu Jumuiya yetu.

1. Ee Mungu twakuomba ulinde
Jumuiya Africa Mashariki
Tuwezeshe kuishi kwa amani
Tutimize na malengo yetu

2. Uzalendo pia mshikamano
Viwe msingi wa Umoja wetu
Natulinde Uhuru na Amani
Mila zetu na desturi zetu.

3. Viwandani na hata mashambani
Tufanye kazi sote kwa makini
Tujitoe kwa hali na mali
Tuijenge Jumuiya bora.

Contact Information:
Address: 32km North of Kampala, Gayaza-Zirobwe Rd, Near Busiika Town Council, Luweero, UGANDA
Postal: P.O. Box 6529, Kampala, UGANDA
Tel: (256) 312 351400
Mob/WhatsApp: +256 773 408 090
Email: registrar@bugemauniv.ac.ug
Website: www.bugemauniv.ac.ug
Bugema University is located 32 kilometers north of Kampala on Gayaza-Zirobwe Road. Public Taxis cost approx. Ushs 5,000 from Old Taxi Park, Kampala. Special hire cars approx. UShs 70,000.

Brief History:
1927: First Adventist educational institution in Nchwanga.
1948: Moved to Bugema (640 acres).
1950: Secondary education started.
1970: Junior college for pastors.
1974: Upgrade to 4-year seminary (BTh).
1994: Licensed as university.
2009: Granted Charter by President Museveni.
2010: Launched Graduate School.
Currently offers Undergraduate, Graduate, and PhD programs.

Philosophy: True education fosters the restoration of the lost image of God in human beings through the harmonious development of the physical, mental, social, and spiritual dimensions (Head, Heart, and Hand - 3H program).

Vision: A Christian University of choice for Excellence in Education and Skilling.
Motto: Excellence in Service.
Mission: To offer an excellent and distinctive holistic Christian education designed to prepare students for productive lives of useful service to God and Society with integrity, honesty, and loyalty.

Spiritual Life: Central to Bugema. Students expected to attend weekly Convocations (Tuesdays 10:00-11:00am) and other worship services.
Sabbath Observance: Observed from sunset Friday to sunset Saturday. A day of rest and worship. All students expected to respect the sacredness of the day.
Activities: Prayer bands, witnessing, Adventist Youth Society.
Food Services: Cafeteria provides balanced vegetarian diet (included in boarding fees). No cooking allowed in rooms. Snack center available.

Housing: Female students encouraged to live in on-campus residence halls (beds provided, bring mattress/bedding). Male students can live in approved private hostels near campus. Married housing not available. Room/board charged for vacation stay.

Code of Conduct: Upholds Christian principles. Prohibited: Illegal drugs, alcohol, tobacco, gambling, vulgar language, violence, immorality, public sexual intimacy, theft, unauthorized meetings. Dress code applies. Violation leads to disciplinary action.

Library: Named after pioneer E. W. Petersen. Provides books, e-journals, internet access. 
Opening Hours:
Sun-Thu: 7:30am-6:00pm, 7:30pm-10:00pm
Fri: 7:30am-12:00noon
Sat: 7:30pm-10:00pm
Services: Lending, Literature search, Photocopying, Binding.

keyword: HEAC Higher Education Access Certificate Details
answer:
Higher Education Access Certificate (HEAC): For those needing to upgrade to degree/diploma eligibility.
Duration: 1 year.
Tracks:
1. HEAC (Humanities): For Business, Arts, Theology. (Courses: English, Bible, Computing, Economics, etc.)
2. HEAC (Physical Sciences): For Computing, Tech. (Courses: Math, Physics, Computing.)
3. HEAC (Biological Studies): For Nursing, Agric, Health. (Courses: Biology, Chemistry, Env Studies.)
Pass required to upgrade.

keyword: Bachelor of Science in Software Engineering Program
answer:
The Bachelor of Science in Software Engineering is a 132 Credit Unit program.

**Structure:**
- General Courses: 21 CU
- Major Concentration: 51 CU
- Cognate: 48 CU
- Research Project: 06 CU
- Industrial Attachment: 06 CU

**Core Courses:** Software Engineering Ethics, Programming (C, VB.Net, Python, Java), Data Structures, Linux, UI/UX, Android, AI, Data Science, and more.

keyword: Bachelor of Science in Network Systems Administration Program
answer:
The Bachelor of Science in Network Systems Administration is a 130 Credit Unit program.

**Structure:**
- Major Concentration: 63 CU
- Cognate: 34 CU
- General Courses: 21 CU
- Research & Project: 12 CU

**Core Courses:** Internet Working, Network Engineering, Computer Architecture, Data Comm, Windows/Linux Server Admin, Cloud Computing, Cyber Security, etc.

The Bachelor of Business Computing is a 134 Credit Unit program.

**Structure:**
- Major Concentration: 54 CU
- Cognate: 47 CU
- General Courses: 21 CU
- Projects/Training: 12 CU

**Core Focus:** Database Systems, Web Design, Information Systems, E-commerce, Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, Accounting, and Business Law.

keyword: Bachelor of Library and Information Science Program
answer:

- Cognate: 39 CU

**Core Topics:** Information Literacy, Resource Management, Knowledge Classification, Cataloguing, Library Operations, Records Management, Archives, and Marketing of Info Services.

keyword: Bachelor of Information Technology BIT Program
answer:
The Bachelor of Information Technology (BIT) is a 121 Credit Unit program.

**Structure:**
- Major: 50 CU
- Cognate: 39 CU
- General: 17 CU
- Research/Project/Internship: 15 CU

**Core Topics:** Principles of Programming, Data Warehousing, IT Risk Mgmt, Mobile App Programming, Enterprise Architecture, Computer Forensics, System Administration.

The Diploma in Computer Forensics requires 88 Credit Units.

**Core Courses:** Security Risk Assessment, Computer Forensics Principles, Cyber Security Concepts, Mobile Forensics, Digital Crime Investigation, Privacy Law, Penetration Testing, Ethical Hacking.

The Diploma in Information Technology requires 88 Credit Units.

**Core Courses:** Multimedia & Graphics, Relational Databases, Web Development, Windows OS, Network Principles, PC Repair, Systems Project.

keyword: Certificate in Information Technology UBTEB Program
answer:
The Certificate in Information Technology (UBTEB) is a 91 Credit Hour program.

**Core Modules:** Fund. of IT, Microsoft Office, HTML/Web Programming, Computer Graphics, Networking, Visual Basic, Computer Maintenance and Real Life Projects.

keyword: Diploma in Science Laboratory Technology Program
answer:
The Diploma in Science Laboratory Technology requires 82 Credit Units. It has concentrations in Biological, Chemistry, and Physics.

**Core Topics:** Lab Science & Tech, Lab Management, Electronics, Instrumental Analysis. 

**Concentrations:** 
- Biological: Bacteriology, Biotechnology, Enzymology.
- Chemistry: Physical/Organic/Inorganic Chemistry.
- Physics: Electricity, Optics, Thermodynamics.

keyword: Diploma in Biomedical Engineering Technology DBET Program
answer:
The Diploma in Biomedical Engineering Technology (DBET) is a 99 Credit Unit program.

**Core Topics:** Biomedical Eng & Lab Equipment, Engineering Drawing, Electronics, Anatomy & Physiology, Bio-Instrumentation, Medical Imaging Systems, Medical Device Standards.

**BSTA 1101 Statistical Packages I:** Intro to Excel, SPSS, EPI data.
**BSTA 1103 Numerical Methods:** Approximating mathematical procedures, error analysis.
**BSTA 1104 Decision Sciences:** Discrete optimization, decision trees, games.
**BSTA 1208 Experimental Designs:** Analysis of designs (random, block, Latin squares) in research.
**BSTA 3205 Intro to Machine Learning:** Classification, Bayes risk, logistic regression, clustering.

**BIOC 1101 Intro to Enzymology:** Immune system defense, antibodies, immunity.
**BIOC 1102 Molecular Genetics:** Structure/function of DNA/RNA, genetic engineering.
**BIOC 1103 Cell Biology:** Organelles, bio membranes, cell cycle, signaling.
**BIOC 2202 Cancer Biology:** Molecular basis of cancer, oncogenes, tumor suppressors.
**BIOC 2107 Medical Biochemistry:** Clinical chemistry, human specimen analysis, metabolic disorders.
